name: method-ui

accordion.name: Accordion
accordion.description: A vertically stacked set of interactive headings that each reveal a section of content.

examples.title: Basic
examples.source: What is React? React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components. What is Solid? SolidJS is a declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces with fine-grained reactivity. What is Vue? Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces, designed to be incrementally adoptable.

examples.title: Collapsible
examples.description: Allow all panels to be closed
examples.source: Can I close all items? Yes! With the collapsible prop, you can close all accordion items by clicking the open item. Is it animated? Absolutely. The accordion uses smooth CSS animations for opening and closing.

examples.title: Multiple
examples.description: Allow multiple panels to be open simultaneously
examples.source: Features Full keyboard navigation, collapsible items, and smooth animations built-in. Accessibility Complies with WAI-ARIA design patterns and supports screen readers. Styling Fully customizable with Tailwind CSS and class variance authority.

examples.title: Outlined
examples.source: Installation Install the package using your favorite package manager: npm install @ark-ui/solid Usage Import the components and start building your accordion UI with full TypeScript support. Customization Use CVA variants and Tailwind classes to customize the look and feel.

examples.title: Disabled
examples.source: Available This accordion item is available and can be toggled. Disabled This item is disabled and cannot be opened. Enabled This accordion item is also available.

date-picker.name: DatePicker
date-picker.description: Date picker component built with Ark UI. Supports single date selection, range selection, and multiple date selection with a clean calendar interface.

examples.description: Simple date picker for single date selection

dialog.name: Dialog
dialog.description: A modal dialog component with composable parts. Uses Ark UI for accessibility and focus management.

examples.title: Basic Dialog
examples.description: A simple dialog with trigger, title and description
examples.source:
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger>
    <Button>Open Dialog</Button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  <DialogContent>
    <DialogTitle>
      Dialog Title
      <Badge variant="secondary" class="ml-2">
        New
      </Badge>
    </DialogTitle>
    <DialogDescription>
      This is a basic dialog with a title and description.
    </DialogDescription>
    <DialogFooter>
      <DialogClose>
        <Button variant="outline">Close</Button>
      </DialogClose>
    </DialogFooter>
  </DialogContent>
</Dialog>

examples.title: Controlled Dialog
examples.source:
const dialog = createDialogState();
return (
  <>
    <Button onClick={dialog.open}>Open Dialog</Button>
    <Dialog
      open={dialog.isOpen()}
      onOpenChange={(e) => dialog.setOpen(e.open)}
    >
      <DialogContent>
        <DialogTitle>Controlled Dialog</DialogTitle>
        <DialogDescription>
          This dialog is controlled by external state using the
          createDialogState helper.
        </DialogDescription>
        <DialogFooter>
          <Button variant="outline" onClick={dialog.close}>
            Close
          </Button>
        </DialogFooter>
      </DialogContent>
    </Dialog>
  </>
);

examples.title: Dialog with Form
examples.source: Edit Profile Make changes to your profile here. Click save when you're done.

file-upload.name: FileUpload
file-upload.description: File upload component built with Ark UI. Supports drag and drop, file type restrictions, file size limits, and automatic preview generation for images.

examples.source: <FileUpload maxFiles={5} />

examples.title: Image Upload Only
examples.source:
<FileUpload
  accept="image/png,image/jpeg,image/jpg,image/gif"
  maxFiles={3}
  maxFileSize={5 * 1024 * 1024}
/>

floating-panel.name: FloatingPanel
floating-panel.description: A draggable and resizable floating panel component. Perfect for chat windows, notifications, or any floating UI elements that need to be movable and adjustable.

props.type: (details: { size: { width: number; height: number } }) => void

props.name: onPositionChange
props.type: (details: { position: { x: number; y: number } }) => void

input.name: Input
input.description: Form input component built with Ark UI Field. Supports type variants: text, email, password (with toggle), textarea (with autoresize), and tags (multi-value input). Use with Field.Root for labels, helper text, and error states when needed.

examples.title: Basic Input
Password Input
examples.source: <Input type="password" placeholder="Enter password" />

examples.title: Textarea
examples.source: <Input type="textarea" autoresize placeholder="Enter your message..." />

examples.title: Tags Input
examples.source:
<Input
  type="tags"
  defaultValue={["React", "Solid", "Vue"]}
  placeholder="Add skill..."
/>

examples.title: Combobox Input
examples.description: Searchable dropdown input with optional clear button
examples.source:
<Input
  type="combobox"
  options={["React", "Solid", "Vue", "Svelte", "Angular"]}
  placeholder="Select a framework..."
/>

examples.title: Button Trigger with Icons
examples.description: Menu with button trigger and icon items
examples.source:
<Menu>
  <MenuTrigger variant="outline">
    <div class={cn("h-4 w-4 mr-2", icon("settings"))} />
    Actions
  </MenuTrigger>
  <MenuContent>
    <MenuItem value="new">
      <div class={cn("h-4 w-4 mr-2", icon("file-plus"))} />
      New File
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="open">
      <div class={cn("h-4 w-4 mr-2", icon("folder-open"))} />
      Open File
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="save">
      <div class={cn("h-4 w-4 mr-2", icon("save"))} />
      Save
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuSeparator />
    <MenuItem value="settings">
      <div class={cn("h-4 w-4 mr-2", icon("settings"))} />
      Settings
    </MenuItem>
    <MenuItem value="exit">
      <div class={cn("h-4 w-4 mr-2", icon("log-out"))} />
      Exit
    </MenuItem>
  </MenuContent>
</Menu>
